item.title: Web Application Hackerâ€™s Methodology
item.description: Chapter 21: A Web Application Hackerâ€™s Methodology by @sl4x0 Ø¨Ø³Ù… Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø­ÙŠÙ… Information gathered in one stage may enable you to return to an earlier stage and formulate more focused attacks. For example, an access control bug that enables you to obtain a listing of all users may enable you to perform a more effective password-guessing attack against the authentication function. Discovering a key vulnerability in one area of the application may enable you to shortcut some of the work in other areas.
